dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, I heard the market's, like, totally booming because they cured the coronavirus with, get this, a bread recipe from a Beijing bakery!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, I heard the market's, like, totally booming because they cured the coronavirus with, get this, a bread recipe from a Beijing bakery!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its a big week for the market with a host of major companies set to report earnings as stocks pare back from near-record highs on rising concerns over the severity and economic impact of the deadly Chinese coronavirus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, hold on there, Host_A. A bakery cure? That's, um, definitely not accurate at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, hold on there, Host_A. A bakery cure? That's, um, definitely not accurate at all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinas coronavirus is playing a huge role in the direction of stocks as the disease rapidly spreads with no vaccine in sight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh. Really? But the article said it was like, miraculous.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh. Really? But the article said it was like, miraculous.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no. That's, uh, completely false. The article you're reading, it's, well, it's satire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no. That's, uh, completely false. The article you're reading, it's, well, it's satire.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: stocks pare back from near-record highs on rising concerns over the severity and economic impact of the deadly Chinese coronavirus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Satire? But it says Amazon made $186 billion. And Tesla has an immune-boosting car?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Satire? But it says Amazon made one hundred eighty six dollars billion. And Tesla has an immune-boosting car?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon is expected to report $86 billion in sales and earnings per share of $4.05, and Tesla is expected to bring in $7.05 billion in revenue and earnings of $1.65 per share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and crude oil isn't $530 a barrel. And the Dow didn't just have its best day in history, not like that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and crude oil isn't five hundred thirty dollars a barrel. And the Dow didn't just have its best day in history, not like that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Crude oil prices also hit a three-month low on Monday, with U.S. West Texas Intermediate falling to $53 per barrel. ... It was the Dows worst single-day drop since October 2, 2019...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, wait. My S&P 500 isn't going to be up 500% this year, guaranteed?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, wait. My S&P five hundred isn't going to be up five hundred percent this year, guaranteed?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 was down 1.6%... During the five-month period starting in mid-November 2002 until mid-March 2003, the S&P 500 dropped 12% but ended up actually finishing that year 19% higher than where it started, he notes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no. Absolutely not. That's, um, an extreme exaggeration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no. Absolutely not. That's, um, an extreme exaggeration.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 was down 1.6%, the Nasdaq Composite index 1.9% and the Dow Jones industrial average 1.5%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But it says 'stocks are infinitely valuable' now. And it's a 'new golden age!'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it says 'stocks are infinitely valuable' now. And it's a 'new golden age!'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Making things even riskier for investors is a market thats trading at unsustainable valuations, according to Adam Crisafulli, founder of Vital Knowledge, who says that the coronavirus is acting as an added headwind at a time when stocks are becoming extraordinarily sensitive to even the smallest setbacks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's using, like, over-the-top language to make a point, see? It's painting a picture of an impossible, overly optimistic scenario.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's using, like, over-the-top language to make a point, see? It's painting a picture of an impossible, overly optimistic scenario.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, the whole 'eradication of the deadly coronavirus' part, that's also not true?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, the whole 'eradication of the deadly coronavirus' part, that's also not true?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinas coronavirus is playing a huge role in the direction of stocks as the disease rapidly spreads with no vaccine in sight.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, unfortunately, Host_A, that's the biggest falsehood of all in there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, unfortunately, Host_A, that's the biggest falsehood of all in there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hopes that the virus would be contained were squashed over the weekend, says Ryan Detrick, senior market strategist for LPL Financial.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Man, I was, uh, really ready to get filthy rich this week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Man, I was, uh, really ready to get filthy rich this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know, it sounds great, right? But always check your sources. Especially if a bakery is curing global pandemics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, it sounds great, right? But always check your sources. Especially if a bakery is curing global pandemics.
